Entries.default: "You got the swagger of a man who's helmed a few ships. You looking for crew? I'm the best you'll find."
Entries.female: "You got the swagger of a woman who's helmed a few ships. You looking for crew? I'm the best you'll find."

Entries.default: "What brings you to the bathhouse?"
"Never mind."
"The fine lords and ladies of the Deadfire on display - that, and their coin purses." Her smile is wolfish, all teeth.
"What do you do?"
"Cannoneering, mostly. I got a head for figures and a keen eye."
"I could use someone like you on my crew."
"My skills don't come cheap. Make it worth my while - to the tune of, say, seven hundred copper - and I'll consider it."
"Steady work on a good crew doesn't come around every day."
"I don't think so."
"I'll enjoy the bathhouse a few moments more and meet you on your ship." She tips an imaginary cap to you and returns to enjoying the steam.
"That's certainly your prerogative. Come find me if you change your mind." She waves you off and returns to enjoying the steam.
"Seven hundred copper will look a pittance next to the loot we collect."
"And your crew's better than most, I take it?"
"And how's your crew, better than most?"
"You better be worth it."
"My skills are second-to-none, I'll promise you that. Not every sailor can calculate the ideal trajectory of a cannonball's flight on the fly." She winks.
"We're the best. You'd make us better."
"All right, sweet talker. Two hundred and fifty copper and a top bunk. Deal?"
"There are worse folks to ship out with."
"Deal."
"Pleasure doing business, captain."
"I don't have that much."
"Come and find me when you do, then. I'll be here." She waves you off and returns to enjoying the steam.
"Wow, with a testimonial like that, how I can refuse? Five hundred copper and a top bunk. Deal?"
"Deal."
"Pleasure doing business, captain."
"Ain't a more ruthless bunch of ruffians in the Deadfire."
"Why are you out of work?"
"I'm so good I make the other crew jealous." She smirks.
"No better place in Neketaka to find a wealthy benefactor, except maybe the Wild Mare."
"Changed your mind, have you? Couldn't let me slip away?"
